pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #5501 
- [x] depends on: #5624 
- [x] depends on: #5807

Ported from leanprover-community/mathlib#17275

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5624~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5807~~

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5813022197/job/15759690225)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5813022197/job/15759690511)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5813022197/job/15759690808)
Looks pretty good. Minor comments.

If you move this down about 16 lines you can simplify the proof to the following since you are essentially inlining the proof of `ContinuousLinearMap.le_of_op_norm_le`. Also, maybe you want to make `f` implicit here since this is an `‚Üî`?
```suggestion
theorem op_norm_le_iff {M : ‚Ñù} (hMp : 0 ‚â§ M) :
    ‚Äñf‚Äñ ‚â§ M ‚Üî ‚àÄ x, ‚Äñf x‚Äñ ‚â§ M * ‚Äñx‚Äñ :=
  ‚ü®f.le_of_op_norm_le, op_norm_le_bound f hMp‚ü©
```

this fits on a single line. I thought it was more readable this way, but if you think not you can ignore this.
```suggestion
      ‚àÄ i, BddAbove (range fun k ‚Ü¶ (q i).comp (f k)) ‚àß Continuous (‚®Ü k, (q i).comp (f k)) ] := by
```

Interestingly, this isn't necessary.
```suggestion
```

the next few suggestions are minigolfs that I think help readability.
```suggestion
      simpa using (hx k).le
```
You discovered my secret: `simp` is still too scary for me, I don't even think about it when `rw` works :sweat_smile:

```suggestion
    simpa only [closedBall_iSup bdd _ one_pos, mem_iInter, mem_closedBall_zero] using hx
```

```suggestion
  ¬∑ exact fun H ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®‚®Ü k, (q i).comp (f k), Seminorm.coe_iSup_eq H.1 ‚ñ∏ H.2, le_ciSup H.1‚ü©
```

```suggestion
    exact Metric.equicontinuousAt_of_continuity_modulus p (map_zero p ‚ñ∏ hp.tendsto 0) _ <|
      eventually_of_forall fun x k ‚Ü¶ by simpa using hfp k x
```
Can you please add a docstring explaining the statement of the theorem, as well as a cross reference to `NormedSpace.equicontinuous_TFAE`?

Please add a cross reference to `WithSeminorms.equicontinuous_TFAE`. Oh, and I suppose according to our naming conventions these should both be named `tfae` instead of `TFAE`, right? Or do we have an exception laid out for `TFAE`?

Well we have both [t1Space_TFAE](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Separation.html#t1Space_TFAE) and [IsGalois.tfae](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Galois.html#IsGalois.tfae) so I don't think there's a clear convention yet...
I've asked on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Naming.20convention/near/383372035), but that's no reason to hold this up.

I love `gcongr`
```suggestion
    exact fun C‚ÇÅ C‚ÇÇ hC ‚Ü¶ forall‚ÇÇ_imp fun i x ‚Ü¶ le_trans' <| by gcongr
```
This is because Lean can't see through the `ENNReal := WithTop NNREal` type synonym. Here `erw` works, but it would be better just to copy the lemma across to `ENNReal`. Would you mind doing that?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/LocallyConvex/WithSeminorms): equicontinuity criteria
